WRITING.TEXT: No problem! I think the crust is the best part as I just discovered the magic of Tenderflake haha...
Looks yummy

Recipe is my own!
I made the crust following the Tenderflake box's instructions.
Filling is around 8 small apples, peeled and chopped. Throw it into a pot with around a cup of sugar, 1/4-1/2 cup of brandy and 1-2cups water. Add cinnamon and stir. Cook mixture until boiling and reduce heat. Once mixture is a bit thick add in 1/4 cup of flour and stir. Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Heat oven to 400degrees F. Roll out crust until a very large circle on floured surface. Transfer to greased baking sheet and fill with Apple mixture. Make sure to leave enough crust so you can fold it over. Fold your crust and brush with egg wash and sugar. Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until crust is golden brown.
Remove from heat and drizzle with a mixture of honey and butter. Serve immediately.
Hope you enjoy!
No problem! Let me know how they come out

Sure!
1 cup coconut oil 1 tbsp vanilla 1 cup white sugar 1/2 cup brown sugar 1 egg Pinch of salt 1 tsp baking soda 2 cups flour Any kind of additions you want (chocolate chips, dried fruit etc etc)
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cream coconut oil and sugar for 2 minutes. Add vanilla and egg. Beat until smooth. Add in salt and baking soda. Slowly add in flour and once incorporated mix in your additions. Don't overwork the dough. You can chill the dough for however long you want which will help develop the flavour(I didn't in this case). Shape into balls and place on parchment lined or headed cookie sheet. Bake 10 minutes and then broil the tops for two minutes. Let cool and enjoy!
**** this recipe also makes really good snickerdoodles. Don't add any of the additions and mix together some sugar and cinnamon. Roll the dough balls in the mixture and bake!****

WRITING.TITLE: Chocolate chip cookies made with coconut oil
A tip for the flakiest pie crust ever!
WRITING.TEXT:
Alright so I've been making pies for about 10 years and it's really been a learning experience.
I've used shortening, butter, coconut oil, regular oil, margarine and lard.
This weekend I made six Pie crusts using Tenderflake lard and the recipe on their box.
Let me tell you that it is the BEST pastry ever. It tastes so good and is so. damn. flakey.
Yes, lard is animal fat and is really bad for you, but pie isn't exactly seen as a health food.

WRITING.TITLE: What is the best purchase you have made for yourself?

WRITING.TEXT:
Usually for baking anything I use unsalted butter. This allows you to control how much salt you want in a recipe and won't risk a too salty recipe.
Graham cracker crust I use unsalted. You don't add salt to a GC crust.

This is a fairly simple recipe(don't be off put by the time):
allrecipes.com/recipe/19165/creme-brulee/
You can use the torch for anything that would normally need broiling. Baked Alaska, lemon meringue pie, getting the cheese bubbly on your casserole etc etc.

WRITING.TITLE: Warm apple galette with honey butter glaze

WRITING.TEXT:
I used this recipe: allrecipes.com/recipe/152915/most-amazing-challah/
It was very sweet as there is quite a lot of honey in it. To be honest I didn't really like it as it turned out very dense and too sweet (still tasted good though). Also it calls for a lot of olive oil which I wasn't too happy about.
If you want a really good challah, use the Betty Crocker Rich egg bread recipe. It's in the Betty Crocker cookbook (the red one) which I swear by as everything I've made has turned out great. Not sure if it's online but if not then just PM me and I'll send you the recipe!
It's more of a sweet egg bread! I recommend making it and using it for French toast or bread pudding
You can tell these are really chewy...they look so good!! Chocolate chip cookies are my favourite things to bake

I can tell you from a personal perspective that it has a lot to do with how the person is wired. Drugs obviously aren't used by just one specific demographic. Sure, some drugs like crack-cocaine are used by those who are "lowely" and cocaine is used by "rich party animals;" however, there is not set demographic.
It can start with morbid curiosity. What does it feel like to be high on heroin? Just once wouldn't hurt would it? Thus ending in addiction to the drug (but not always).
Of course you have to have the resources. And using other drugs can open up doors like that. People say marijuana is a gateway drug not because it will make you want to try harder things- but because it allows you to step foot into the world which is drugs. You meet people who know people who can score you some coke. Of course not everyone who does drugs like marijuana or cocaine etc etc(anything less harsh than heroin) ends up using harder drugs. They just become more easily accessible is all.
And then there is the whole mental factor. Those who are mentally ill are more likely to turn to drugs to cope with their pain. A temporary fix may become a necessity to stay alive.
Friends, family, parents who use drugs can have an impact on a person and they may begin to use.
There are tons of factors as to why people begin to use heroin. Each person's reason is different. People obviously know it's bad and it's like every other addiction: once it's started its hard to stop.

WRITING.TITLE: Where are some good cities to backpack in?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm thinking of taking a semester off and backpacking around the globe. I want to go to Europe and japan but I'm a single young woman traveling alone. Which cities are safest and cheapest?
Thanks!
*Any tips would be great too!

My experience is that you will need to have proof of sufficient funds while you stay in the US. You might need permission from your parents (not sure though) and you obviously need to use your passport and licence. Your best bet is to go on the border website and look at their FAQ. You can also contact them by phone or email.
You need to prove that you are just visiting the states and will be returning to Canada. This is why it's good to print out an itinerary and hotel bookings. Bring your debit or credit card. Don't say anything stupid while at the border. Because you're so young and traveling without a parent, you'll be more likely to be questioned and pulled over.
That being said, just do your research and make sure you have all the documentation.

WRITING.TITLE: Chocolate cupcakes with Nutella buttercream

WRITING.TEXT: Those are so pretty!

Coffee crisp is the best chocolate to receive EVER. You can head over to r/snackexchange if you want the legit thing but to make it at home I'm not too sure.
It's mainly comprised of wafer and chocolate. What I would do is buy wafers (they sell them just plain in layers) and then make a coffee buttercream or coffee and chocolate ganache. Keep stacking them until it's the desired consistency and then dip into melted milk chocolate.
Ive found a recipe for Kit Kats which are relatively similar to coffee crisps. m.instructables.com/id/Homemade-Kit-Kat-Candy-Bar-Recipe/
